message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
private void saveSolutionToCSV(List<MyClass> solution) {
    int columnSize = solution.get(0).getSize();
    try {
        FileWriter writer = new FileWriter("test.csv");
        Iterator<MyClass> result = solution.iterator();
        while(result.hasNext()) {
            MyClass myClass = result.next();
            for(int i = 0; i < columnSize; i++) {
                String element = myClass.toString();
                writer.write(element);
                if(i < columnSize - 1)
                    writer.write(',');
            }
            writer.write('\n');
        }
        writer.close();
    }
    catch(Exception e)
    {
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The problem is that you are trying to cast MyClass to CharSequence which is not possible. Instead, you should call the toString() method on the MyClass object to get a String representation of it. Then you can write this String to the file using the write() method of FileWriter. Also, don't forget to close the FileWriter after you are done with it to free up system resources.
